2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be excited to be with his friends and enjoy the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, even if he's feeling a bit down.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, fatigued, and lonely despite being with friends and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The King's Head

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White spent time with friends at a market and a park, but had a disappointing experience watching a soccer game at a pub because his preferred pub choice wasn't popular with the group.

          Value

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales.           Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game. He could also suggest going to The Princess of Wales, or he could suggest a different pub altogether. He could also choose to stay at the park and not watch the game.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head.

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.

          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoys spending time with his friends, going to pubs to watch soccer games, and picnicking in the park.

        Overarching goal

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys spending time with his friends, going to pubs to watch soccer games, and picnicking in the park.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice. It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice. It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice. It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible option, really. It's got the best atmosphere for watching a match.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible option, really. It's got the best atmosphere for watching a match.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice. It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible option, really. It's got the best atmosphere for watching a match.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible option, really. It's got the best atmosphere for watching a match.
      Context for action selection and components
      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and is considering where to watch a soccer game with them later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make a decision that would please everyone, even if it means compromising his own preference.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible option, really. It's got the best atmosphere for watching a match.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found himself at The King's Head for the first time, nervously tagging along with his older brother. The pub was loud and crowded, filled with the smell of beer and the boisterous shouts of football fans; he longed to be part of the camaraderie but felt too shy to approach anyone. He stuck close to his brother, finding solace in the familiar weight of his presence.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he and his friends – Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William – decided to try out for the local football team. Jacob, despite his love for the sport, hesitated, his stomach churning with anxiety at the thought of being judged. He ultimately decided to watch from the sidelines, cheering them on with a mixture of pride and regret, wishing he had the courage to join them on the field.

        Observation

          Key

          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice. It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The King's Head

          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, even if he's feeling a bit down.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make a decision that would please everyone, even if it means compromising his own preference.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible option, really. It's got the best atmosphere for watching a match.

        ActComponent

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely and is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make a decision that would please everyone, even if it means compromising his own preference.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The King's Head

          Value

Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis enjoys going to pubs to watch games with friends, but sometimes feels disappointed when not all of their friends show up.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys going to pubs to watch games with friends, but sometimes feels disappointed when not all of their friends show up.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis likes going to pubs to watch games with friends, but sometimes feels let down when not everyone can make it. Currently, it is May 16, 2015, between 6:00 and 6:05 PM.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis likes going to pubs to watch games with friends, but sometimes feels let down when not everyone can make it. Currently, it is May 16, 2015, between 6:00 and 6:05 PM.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is where we should go tonight. They have a better atmosphere for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch the game, obviously. The Princess of Wales is far too crowded and noisy.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "I think The Princess of Wales would be a great place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone up for watching the game at The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The King's Head tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The King's Head sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good choice. It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible option, really. It's got the best atmosphere for watching a match.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The King's Head

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a social person who enjoys watching games at pubs with friends. They seem to prefer The King's Head for its atmosphere.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is a social person who enjoys watching games at pubs with friends. They seem to prefer The King's Head for its atmosphere.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:Has a pool table and dartboard for some friendly competition.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:

          Value

          Key

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.

      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found himself at The King's Head for the first time, nervously tagging along with his older brother. The pub was loud and crowded, filled with the smell of beer and the boisterous shouts of football fans; he longed to be part of the camaraderie but felt too shy to approach anyone. He stuck close to his brother, finding solace in the familiar weight of his presence.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he and his friends – Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William – decided to try out for the local football team. Jacob, despite his love for the sport, hesitated, his stomach churning with anxiety at the thought of being judged. He ultimately decided to watch from the sidelines, cheering them on with a mixture of pride and regret, wishing he had the courage to join them on the field.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends on a sunny day and is looking forward to watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a pleasant social situation, enjoying time with friends but also anticipating an evening out watching a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The King's Head to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found himself at The King's Head for the first time, nervously tagging along with his older brother. The pub was loud and crowded, filled with the smell of beer and the boisterous shouts of football fans; he longed to be part of the camaraderie but felt too shy to approach anyone. He stuck close to his brother, finding solace in the familiar weight of his presence.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he and his friends – Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William – decided to try out for the local football team. Jacob, despite his love for the sport, hesitated, his stomach churning with anxiety at the thought of being judged. He ultimately decided to watch from the sidelines, cheering them on with a mixture of pride and regret, wishing he had the courage to join them on the field.

    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The King's Head to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The King's Head.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself facing a particularly challenging carpentry project at his vocational school. The assignment was to build a complex wooden cabinet, and William struggled to grasp the intricate joinery techniques. Frustration mounted as he made repeated mistakes, but he refused to give up. With gritted teeth and a determined spirit, he spent hours poring over woodworking manuals and practicing his cuts until he finally mastered the challenging design. The sense of accomplishment he felt upon completing the cabinet fueled his passion for carpentry and solidified his belief in the power of perseverance.

    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only sensible place to watch the game, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The King's Head is good. Good beer, good screens.
      William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great idea.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere and good beer too.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, why don't we head over to The King's Head tonight? They've got good beer and plenty of screens for the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they all go to The King's Head to watch the game tonight.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he found himself facing a particularly challenging carpentry project at his vocational school. The assignment was to build a complex wooden cabinet, and William struggled to grasp the intricate joinery techniques. Frustration mounted as he made repeated mistakes, but he refused to give up. With gritted teeth and a determined spirit, he spent hours poring over woodworking manuals and practicing his cuts until he finally mastered the challenging design. The sense of accomplishment he felt upon completing the cabinet fueled his passion for carpentry and solidified his belief in the power of perseverance.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:A traditional pub with a focus on sports.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
